_header: In secret place this hinder night
Subjects: dialogues, lovers’; women, as speakers/narrators; ribaldry; erotic verse
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Ane Brash of Wowing’ — nine 7-line stanzas including alternating refrains, ‘ȝe brek my hart my bony ane’ and ‘ffull leifis me ȝour graceles gane’

CULLl510.First Lines:
In secreit place þis hinder nichtI hard ane beyrne say till
                    ane bricht…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Weis me quod sho quhair will ȝe manBest now I luff
                    þat graceles gane

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
In Secreit place þis hyndir nychtI hard ane beyrne say till
                    ane bricht…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Wo is me quod Scho quhair will ȝe manBest now I luif
                    þat graceles gane

Banna.First Lines:
In secreit place this hindir nychtI hard ane bern say till a
                    bricht…
Banna.Last Lines:
…ffow wo quod scho quhair will ȝe manfull leis me that
                    graceles gane
